intro: Microcharis pseudoindigofera, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped, palmate leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and as a decorative plant.
